Patients randomize control group ( G-K , n:20 ) , IS group ( G-IS , n:20 ) CPAP ( continuous positive airway pressure ) group ( G-CPAP , n:20 )
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Effectiveness Postoperative Incentive Spirometry Noninvasive Mechanical Ventilation Patients Following Craniotomy
DOC.detailed_description: This study compare effectiveness postoperative incentive spirometry noninvasive mechanical ventilation pulmonary function craniotomy 60 patient . Patients randomize control group ( G-K , n:20 ) , IS group ( G-IS , n:20 ) CPAP ( continuous positive airway pressure ) group ( G-CPAP , n:20 ) . The investigator include male female , 18 60 year old , American Society Anesthesiologists score 1 , 2 patient study . The investigator exclude patient significant cardiopulmonary disease like myocardial infarction , obstructive restrictive pulmonary disease , liver kidney failure , chest wall deformity , postoperative lack cooperation study . In postoperatively , control group take 4lt/min oxygen Plasti-med oxygen therapy mask 6 hour , IS group carry Plasti-med TRIFLO 5 min per hour 6 hour , CPAP group carry 10 cmH2O noninvasive continuous positive airway pressure BIPAP VISION 5 min per hour 6 hour . Lung function arterial blood gas analysis record preoperative baseline , postoperative 1st , 6th 24th hour .
DOC.criteria: American Society Anesthesiologists score 1 , 2 patient Patients significant cardiopulmonary disease like myocardial infarction , obstructive restrictive pulmonary disease , liver kidney failure , chest wall deformity , postoperative lack cooperation
